events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their car and a tree during a heavy rainstorm, resulting in significant front-end damage.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and incident details submitted by the claimant.
A claims agent was assigned to handle the customer's case and to coordinate further communication and investigation steps.
The customer received an acknowledgment email confirming the claim was registered and an agent would contact them shortly.
The claims agent requested the vehicle repair estimate, police report, and photographs of the damage to process the claim further.
The customer submitted all requested documents including the police accident report, mechanic’s estimate, and insurance form.
An investigation was initiated to verify the claim details and assess the damage to determine liability and coverage.
The investigation concluded that the accident circumstances align with the claimant's report, confirming eligibility for coverage.
A settlement offer was proposed covering the repair costs and vehicle towing fees based on the assessed damages.
The customer responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the prompt handling of their auto accident claim.
Following acceptance of the settlement terms, the claim was officially approved to proceed with payment issuance.
The approved payment amount was issued to the customer’s bank account to cover all repair and damage-related expenses.
The claim was officially closed after successful payment and confirmation from the customer that repairs were underway.
The entire claim file was archived in compliance with policy documentation retention requirements for future reference.
